00015 //  Intel compiler setup:
00016 
00017 #include "boost/config/compiler/common_edg.hpp"
00018 
00019 #if defined(__INTEL_COMPILER)
00020 #  define BOOST_INTEL_CXX_VERSION __INTEL_COMPILER
00021 #elif defined(__ICL)
00022 #  define BOOST_INTEL_CXX_VERSION __ICL
00023 #elif defined(__ICC)
00024 #  define BOOST_INTEL_CXX_VERSION __ICC
00025 #elif defined(__ECC)
00026 #  define BOOST_INTEL_CXX_VERSION __ECC
00027 #endif
00028 
00029 #define BOOST_COMPILER "Intel C++ version " BOOST_STRINGIZE(BOOST_INTEL_CXX_VERSION)
00030 #define BOOST_INTEL BOOST_INTEL_CXX_VERSION
00031 
00032 #if (BOOST_INTEL_CXX_VERSION <= 500) && defined(_MSC_VER)
00033 #  define BOOST_NO_EXPLICIT_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_ARGUMENTS
00034 #  define BOOST_NO_TEMPLATE_TEMPLATES
00035 #endif
00036 
00037 #if (BOOST_INTEL_CXX_VERSION <= 600) || !defined(BOOST_STRICT_CONFIG)
00038 
00039 #  if defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER <= 1300) // added check for <= VC 7 (Peter Dimov)
00040 
00041 // Boost libraries assume strong standard conformance unless otherwise
00042 // indicated by a config macro. As configured by Intel, the EDG front-end
00043 // requires certain compiler options be set to achieve that strong conformance.
00044 // Particularly /Qoption,c,--arg_dep_lookup (reported by Kirk Klobe & Thomas Witt)
00045 // and /Zc:wchar_t,forScope. See boost-root/tools/build/intel-win32-tools.jam for
00046 // details as they apply to particular versions of the compiler. When the
00047 // compiler does not predefine a macro indicating if an option has been set,
00048 // this config file simply assumes the option has been set.
00049 // Thus BOOST_NO_ARGUMENT_DEPENDENT_LOOKUP will not be defined, even if
00050 // the compiler option is not enabled.
00051 
00052 #     define BOOST_NO_SWPRINTF
00053 #  endif
00054 
00055 // Void returns, 64 bit integrals don't work when emulating VC 6 (Peter Dimov)
00056 
00057 #  if defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER <= 1200)
00058 #     define BOOST_NO_VOID_RETURNS
00059 #     define BOOST_NO_INTEGRAL_INT64_T
00060 #  endif
00061 
00062 #endif
00063 
00064 // See http://aspn.activestate.com/ASPN/Mail/Message/boost/1614864
00065 #if BOOST_INTEL_CXX_VERSION < 700
00066 #  define BOOST_NO_INTRINSIC_WCHAR_T
00067 #else
00068 // _WCHAR_T_DEFINED is the Win32 spelling
00069 // _WCHAR_T is the Linux spelling
00070 #  if !defined(_WCHAR_T_DEFINED) && !defined(_WCHAR_T)
00071 #    define BOOST_NO_INTRINSIC_WCHAR_T
00072 #  endif
00073 #endif
00074 
00075 #if (BOOST_INTEL_CXX_VERSION <= 800) || !defined(BOOST_STRICT_CONFIG)
00076 #  define BOOST_FUNCTION_SCOPE_USING_DECLARATION_BREAKS_ADL
00077 #endif
00078 
00079 #if _MSC_VER+0 >= 1000
00080 #  if _MSC_VER >= 1200
00081 #     define BOOST_HAS_MS_INT64
00082 #  endif
00083 #  define BOOST_NO_SWPRINTF
00084 #elif defined(_WIN32)
00085 #  define BOOST_DISABLE_WIN32
00086 #endif
00087 
00088 // I checked version 6.0 build 020312Z, it implements the NRVO.
00089 // Correct this as you find out which version of the compiler
00090 // implemented the NRVO first.  (Daniel Frey)
00091 #if (BOOST_INTEL_CXX_VERSION >= 600)
00092 #  define BOOST_HAS_NRVO
00093 #endif
00094 
00095 //
00096 // versions check:
00097 // we don't support Intel prior to version 5.0:
00098 #if BOOST_INTEL_CXX_VERSION < 500
00099 #  error "Compiler not supported or configured - please reconfigure"
00100 #endif
00101 //
00102 // last known and checked version:
00103 #if (BOOST_INTEL_CXX_VERSION > 800)
00104 #  if defined(BOOST_ASSERT_CONFIG)
00105 #     error "Unknown compiler version - please run the configure tests and report the results"
00106 #  elif defined(_MSC_VER)
00107 #     pragma message("Unknown compiler version - please run the configure tests and report the results")
00108 #  endif
00109 #endif
